section.title: Using &rhla; as a &ceph; Client
section.para: &kw-hos-phrase; supports &rhla; compute nodes as &ceph; storage clients. However, the RPM packages necessary for this functionality are only available directly from &rh;, and are not provided with &kw-hos;. As a result, your &rhla; subscription should be used to obtain the needed RPM packages to enable &ceph; storage client behavior.

If you are still preparing your environment for a new installation (using site.yml) or upgrade (using ardana-upgrade-from-legacy.yml), the below steps should be done at this time, before proceeding, to enable the desired functionality immediately upon completing the installation.

section.title: Hosting &ceph; Client Packages for &rhla; 7.5
section.para: On the &lcm;, execute the following steps:

step.para: Create the directory where the &rhla; packages will be downloaded:
Download the following RPM packages from your &rhla; subscription repository into the ~/third-party/ceph/pkgs/rhel/ directory:
Execute the following commands to deploy and populate the yum repo on the &lcm; with above packages:
step.screen: cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost third-party-deploy.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost third-party-import.yml

section.title: Apply &ceph; Client Packages to &rhla; &compnode;s
section.para: Now that the &ceph; storage client RPMs have been made available from your deployer as a repository for &rhla; compute nodes, you may continue with your normal installation or upgrade steps.

If you are enabling &ceph; storage clients on an existing &kw-hos; cloud (not actively being installed or upgraded), execute these additional commands to apply the new packages to your &rhla; compute nodes:
section.screen: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/ardana/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts osconfig-run.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-client-prepare.yml
section.para: Once these steps are complete, you can proceed to use &ceph; storage functionality on &rhla; compute nodes, or provision new &rhla; compute nodes with this capability enabled.
